title.narrative: Development of a comprehensive investment policy framework that guides responsible investments in selected supply chains and mitigates negative social and environmental impact, based on a policy review

description.narrative: In Uganda, together with government, conservation NGOs and local communities and local producers around the Queen Elizabeth National Park and Bwindi Impenetrable National Park, we launched the Great Lakes Landscape initiative, with the aim to align conservation efforts with socioeconomic development needs to improve the livelihoods of communities whilst protecting and conserving the natural resources base. Four priority value chains were identified: agro-forestry tea, climate smart coffee, aquaculture and women-led horticulture business development. For each priority value chain, Steering Groups have been developed, consisting of public, private and community actors and pilots were initiated to provide the proof of concept of a balanced conservation and production environments. Content for new digital support tools for climate smart coffee production practices have been developed.

title.narrative: Stakeholder dynamics generate dialogue & debate on sustainability & land issues
# + Names of MSPs, networks or dialogues convened or participated in

comment.narrative: 1 on low carbon tea and 1 fisheries and a national MSP on balancing conservation and production

title.narrative: # + Names of MSPs, networks or dialogues convened or participated in

comment.narrative: Horticulture stakeholder dialogue held in Kasese - Coffee stakeholder dialogue for the Great Lakes region held in Kasese, 2 aquaculture dialogues held at Rubirizi and Kamwenge

Ministry of Agriculture, Animal Industries and Fisheries (M.A.A.I.F), National Agriculture Research organisation (NARO), Uganda Wildlife authority (UWA), VI Agroforestry, Uganda National Farmers Federation (UNFFE), Conservation through Public health, Rwebitaba Zardi, Aquafarm

title.narrative: # hectares of forest increased or improved

comment.narrative: This is an approximated avoided deforestation by communities supported through pilots, farmer managed regeneration work for areas surrounding Bwindi forest and by Tea farmers surrounding forests taking up agroforestry interventions and aquaculture farmers around Kibale forest.

title.narrative: Private and public sector decision-makers agree to develop measures
# + kind of new private partnerships for implementation of sustainable practices

comment.narrative: the private partnerships are in Coffee (Gorilla Conservation Coffee) piloting CSA interventions around forest areas, the other private partnership is on Aquaculture (AquaFarm) which is piloting landscape smart practices around river ecosystem.
